channel.title: CVE Feed for Progress Software Corporation -- WhatsUp Gold
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Progress Software Corporation -- WhatsUp Gold

item.title: CVE-2024-5013|2024-06-25T20:11:58.100Z -- progress%20software%20corporation -- whatsup%20gold
item.description:
In WhatsUp Gold versions released before 2023.1.3, an unauthenticated Denial of Service
vulnerability was identified. An unauthenticated attacker can put the application into the SetAdminPassword installation step, which renders the application non-accessible.

item.title: CVE-2024-4885|2024-06-25T20:32:53.200Z -- progress%20software%20corporation -- whatsup%20gold
item.description:
In WhatsUp Gold versions released before 2023.1.3, an unauthenticated Remote Code Execution vulnerability in Progress WhatsUpGold. The
WhatsUp.ExportUtilities.Export.GetFileWithoutZip
allows execution of commands with iisapppool\nmconsole privileges.

item.title: CVE-2024-5015|2024-06-25T20:15:07.575Z -- progress%20software%20corporation -- whatsup%20gold
item.description: In WhatsUp Gold versions released before 2023.1.3, an authenticated SSRF vulnerability in Wug.UI.Areas.Wug.Controllers.SessionControler.Update allows a low privileged user to chain this SSRF with an Improper Access Control vulnerability. This can be used to escalate privileges to Admin.

item.title: CVE-2024-5017|2024-06-25T20:25:37.761Z -- progress%20software%20corporation -- whatsup%20gold
item.description: In WhatsUp Gold versions released before 2023.1.3, a path traversal vulnerability exists. A specially crafted unauthenticated HTTP request to AppProfileImport can lead can lead to information disclosure.

item.title: CVE-2024-5011|2024-06-25T20:01:47.996Z -- progress%20software%20corporation -- whatsup%20gold
item.description: In WhatsUp Gold versions released before 2023.1.3, an uncontrolled resource consumption vulnerability exists. A specially crafted unauthenticated HTTP request to the TestController Chart functionality can lead to denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2024-5014|2024-06-25T20:13:21.304Z -- progress%20software%20corporation -- whatsup%20gold
item.description: In WhatsUp Gold versions released before 2023.1.3, a Server Side Request Forgery vulnerability exists in the GetASPReport feature. This allows any authenticated user to retrieve ASP reports from an HTML form.

item.title: CVE-2024-5018|2024-06-25T20:27:11.395Z -- progress%20software%20corporation -- whatsup%20gold
item.description: In WhatsUp Gold versions released before 2023.1.3, an unauthenticated Path Traversal vulnerability exists Wug.UI.Areas.Wug.Controllers.SessionController.LoadNMScript. This allows allows reading of any file from the applications web-root directory .

item.title: CVE-2024-5012|2024-06-25T20:10:33.358Z -- progress%20software%20corporation -- whatsup%20gold
item.description: In WhatsUp Gold versions released before 2023.1.3, there is a missing authentication vulnerability in WUGDataAccess.Credentials. This vulnerability allows unauthenticated attackers to disclose Windows Credentials stored in the product Credential Library.

item.title: CVE-2024-5016|2024-06-25T20:23:46.895Z -- progress%20software%20corporation -- whatsup%20gold
item.description: In WhatsUp Gold versions released before 2023.1.3, Distributed Edition installations can be exploited by using a deserialization tool to achieve a Remote Code Execution as SYSTEM. The vulnerability exists in the main message processing routines NmDistributed.DistributedServiceBehavior.OnMessage for server and NmDistributed.DistributedClient.OnMessage for clients.

item.title: CVE-2024-5009|2024-06-25T20:37:14.289Z -- progress%20software%20corporation -- whatsup%20gold
item.description: In WhatsUp Gold versions released before 2023.1.3, an Improper Access Control vulnerability in Wug.UI.Controllers.InstallController.SetAdminPassword allows local attackers to modify admin's password.

item.title: CVE-2024-5019|2024-06-25T20:29:00.522Z -- progress%20software%20corporation -- whatsup%20gold
item.description:
In WhatsUp Gold versions released before 2023.1.3,
an unauthenticated Arbitrary File Read issue exists in Wug.UI.Areas.Wug.Controllers.SessionController.CachedCSS. This vulnerability allows reading of any file with iisapppool\NmConsole privileges.

item.title: CVE-2024-4562|2024-06-04T17:56:09.548Z -- progress%20software%20corporation -- whatsup%20gold
item.description:
In WhatsUp Gold versions released before 2023.1.2 ,
an SSRF vulnerability exists in Whatsup Gold's
Issue exists in the HTTP Monitoring functionality.
Due to the lack of proper authorization, any authenticated user can access the HTTP monitoring functionality, what leads to the Server Side Request Forgery.

item.title: CVE-2024-4561|2024-06-04T17:53:36.300Z -- progress%20software%20corporation -- whatsup%20gold
item.description:
In WhatsUp Gold versions released before 2023.1.2 ,
a blind SSRF vulnerability exists in Whatsup Gold's FaviconController that allows an attacker to send arbitrary HTTP requests on behalf of the vulnerable server.

item.title: CVE-2024-4883|2024-06-25T19:44:42.139Z -- progress%20software%20corporation -- whatsup%20gold
item.description: In WhatsUp Gold versions released before 2023.1.3, a Remote Code Execution issue exists in Progress WhatsUp Gold. This vulnerability allows an unauthenticated attacker to achieve the RCE as a service account through NmApi.exe.

item.title: CVE-2024-5009|2024-06-25T19:58:48.237Z -- progress%20software%20corporation -- whatsup%20gold
item.description: In WhatsUp Gold versions released before 2023.1.3, an Improper Access Control vulnerability in Wug.UI.Controllers.InstallController.SetAdminPassword allows local attackers to modify admin's password.

item.title: CVE-2024-4884|2024-06-25T19:46:22.692Z -- progress%20software%20corporation -- whatsup%20gold
item.description:
In WhatsUp Gold versions released before 2023.1.3, an unauthenticated Remote Code Execution vulnerability in Progress WhatsUpGold. The Apm.UI.Areas.APM.Controllers.CommunityController
allows execution of commands with iisapppool\nmconsole privileges.

item.title: CVE-2024-5010|2024-06-25T20:00:07.728Z -- progress%20software%20corporation -- whatsup%20gold
item.description:
In WhatsUp Gold versions released before 2023.1.3, a vulnerability exists in the TestController functionality. A specially crafted
unauthenticated
HTTP request can lead to a disclosure of sensitive information.

item.title: CVE-2024-4885|2024-06-25T19:48:15.268Z -- progress%20software%20corporation -- whatsup%20gold
item.description:
In WhatsUp Gold versions released before 2023.1.3, an unauthenticated Remote Code Execution vulnerability in Progress WhatsUpGold. The
WhatsUp.ExportUtilities.Export.GetFileWithoutZip
allows execution of commands with iisapppool\nmconsole privileges.

item.title: CVE-2024-5008|2024-06-25T19:57:16.744Z -- progress%20software%20corporation -- whatsup%20gold
item.description:
In WhatsUp Gold versions released before 2023.1.3,
an authenticated user with certain permissions can upload an arbitrary file and obtain RCE using Apm.UI.Areas.APM.Controllers.Api.Applications.AppProfileImportController.
